newsitem.title: DENMARK: ODENSE CONFIRMS BALTIC SHIPYARD DEAL.
newsitem.headline: ODENSE CONFIRMS BALTIC SHIPYARD DEAL.

text.p: Danish Odense shipyard, owned by industrial combine A.P. Moeller, has bought a controlling stake in Lithuanian shipmaker Baltic Shipyard, the company confirmed on Friday.
News of the purchase has already come out in Lithuania, where the price of Baltic's shares on the bourse soared on Tuesday as the deal was carried out in the market.
The Danish company confirmed the deal in a statement but did not say how much it paid for the shares.
"Odense has after long discssions bought a deciding majority," the company said.

Odense already has a stake in Estonian ship repair company Loksa. The deals in the Baltics are part of its strategy of diversifying outside Denmark as it faces the end to subsidies to the ship building industry from the end of this year.
"The coordination, specialisation and cooperation between Odense, Loksa and Klaipeda will lead to an increase in efficiency, which is needed for survival under the new circumstances," Odense said.
Odense said that Baltic Shipyard has around 1,500 employees and makes small ships, container feed ships and supply ships.
"These are all types of vessels which A.P. Moeller needs," Odense added.
